description:
'''Bọ̀lọ̀jọ̀''' is an African dancing and popular musical style among the [[Yewa]] Yoruba clans situated in the western regions of [[Ogun State]], [[Nigeria]] and other closely linked [[Yoruba people|Yoruba]] subgroups in the nearby [[Plateau Department]] of  [[Benin]].

It is mostly featured in festivals, parties and in [[Gelede]] shows.

Beninese singer [[Zeynab Habib]] is also known for her popular recreation of Bolojo dances.
